Histogram.description: The grouping of the data into bins, plotting the number of members in each bin against the bin number.

Skewness.description: Computes the skewness of a data set.
Skewness.reference: Zwillinger, D. and Kokoska, S. (2000). CRC Standard Probability and Statistics Tables and Formulae. Champman and Hall: New York. 2000.

Kurtosis.description: Computes the kurtosis (Pearson) of a data set.
Kurtosis.reference: Zwillinger, D. and Kokoska, S. (2000). CRC Standard Probability and Statistics Tables and Formulae. Champman and Hall: New York. 2000.

Mean.description: Computes the arithmetic mean along the specified axis.

Median.description: Computes the median along the specified axis.

Max.description: Computes the maximum value along the specified axis.

Min.description: Computes the minimum value along the specified axis.

Variance.description: Computes the variance of a data set.

Standard Deviation.description: Computes the standard deviation along the specified axis.

Root mean square.description: The square root of the arithmetic mean (average) of the squares of the original values.

Interquartile range.description: Computes the interquartile range for the provided sequence of values, a more robust estimation than the variance.

Median absolute deviation.description: Computes the median absolute deviation for the provided sequence of values, a more robust estimation than the variance.

Mean absolute deviation.description: Computes the mean absolute deviation for the provided sequence of values, a more robust estimation than the variance.

Signal distance.description: Computes the length of the signal.

Minimum peaks.description: Returns the number of minimum peaks of a data set.

Maximum peaks.description: Returns the number of maximum peaks of a data set.

Centroid.description: Computes the centroid of a data set.
Centroid.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Mean absolute diff.description: Computes the mean of the absolute differences between two consequent values.

Median absolute diff.description: Computes the median of the absolute differences between two consequent values.

Sum absolute diff.description: Computes the sum of the absolute differences between two consequent values.

Mean diff.description: Computes the mean of the differences between two consequent values.

Median diff.description: Computes the median of the differences between two consequent values.

Zero crossing rate.description: The zero-crossing rate is a measure of the number of time the signal value cross the zero axe.

Maximum frequency.description: Compute the one-dimensional discrete Fourier Transform and with cumsum function find 95% of max frequency.

Median frequency.description: Compute the one-dimensional discrete Fourier Transform and with cumsum function find 50% of max frequency.

Fundamental frequency.description: Computes the fundamental frequency along the specified axis.For an harmonic signal,the fundamental frequency is the frequency so thats its integer multiple best explain the content of the signal spectrum.

Total energy.description: Computes the total energy of a data set.
Total energy.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Max power spectrum.description: Compute power spectrum density along the specified axes and return the maximum value.

Spectral centroid.description: Computes the spectral centroid of a data set.
Spectral centroid.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Spectral spread.description: Computes the spectral spread of a data set.
Spectral spread.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Spectral skewness.description: Computes the spectral skewness of a data set.
Spectral skewness.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Spectral kurtosis.description: Computes the spectral kurtosis of a data set.
Spectral kurtosis.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Spectral slope.description: Computes the spectral slope of a data set.
Spectral slope.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Spectral decrease.description: Computes the spectral decrease of a data set.
Spectral decrease.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Spectral roll-on.description: Computes the spectral roll-on of a dataset.
Spectral roll-on.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Spectral roll-off.description: Computes the spectral roll-off of a dataset.
Spectral roll-off.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Curve distance.description: Computes the curve distance of a dataset.

Spectral variation.description: Computes the spectral variation of a data set.
Spectral variation.reference: G. Peeters, “A large set of audio features for sound description (similarity and classification) in the cuidado project”, 2004.

Linear regression.description: Computes the linear regression of a data set.

Spectral maximum peaks.description: Returns the number of maximum peaks of a data set.
